text: Hey, everybody!
Jon Reep here -- "The Well Readneck."
I don't know if you can tell, but I'm a white person.
So I picked up this book -- "Stuff White People Like,"
and not one of them damn things is mentioned in here.
It says here white people love vintage.
Where I'm from, that's just called being poor.
White people love going to the farmers market.
Hell, where I'm from, they just call it a John Deere Dealership.
Apparently, white people
also love having children in their late 30s.
Well, that one's true.
I've got children in their late 30s,
and, hell, I'm 44.
It says here we love kitchen gadgets.
Now, I know some people that call those wives or moms.
I bet that's what Gwyneth Paltrow calls the maid.
"Honey, have you seen the thing that opens the cans?"
"Oh, you mean Rosa."
And white people apparently love gifted children.
Oh, is that what we're calling them now --
when you drop your baby off at the fire department?
Ding-dong! Got a present!
Merry Christmas!
And according to this, white people love NPR.
I think that's a typo.
Everybody knows it's PBR!
[ Laughs ]
[ Gulping ]
Well, that's it for this edition of "The Well Readneck."
Appreciate you joining us.
Till next time...bicentennial!
[ Classical music plays ]
I need a lighter.
It's in the truck!
